alert.note: Alert for Maries; Phelps (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 12:03AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maries and northern Phelps Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1203 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vienna, or 18 miles northwest of Rolla, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rolla, St. James, Belle, Doolittle, Vienna, Brinktown, Northwye, Vichy and Rosati. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 184 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and east central Missouri.
